Events.text: The second Shia Imam Hassan ibn Ali passes away after being poisoned
Events.html: The second Shia Imam Hassan ibn Ali passes away after being poisoned

Events.text: Spanish explorer Juan Ponce de León first sights land in what is now the United States state of Florida.
Events.html: Spanish explorer Juan Ponce de León first sights land in what is now the United States state of Florida.

Events.text: Commodore William James captures the Maratha fortress of Suvarnadurg on west coast of India.
Events.html: Commodore William James captures the Maratha fortress of Suvarnadurg on west coast of India.

Events.text: The Coinage Act is passed establishing the United States Mint.
Events.html: The Coinage Act is passed establishing the United States Mint.

Events.text: Ludwig van Beethoven leads the premiere of his First Symphony in Vienna.
Events.html: Ludwig van Beethoven leads the premiere of his First Symphony in Vienna.

Events.text: French Revolutionary Wars: The British capture the Danish fleet.
Events.html: French Revolutionary Wars: The British capture the Danish fleet.

Events.text: Rama IV is crowned King of Thailand.
Events.html: Rama IV is crowned King of Thailand.

Events.text: American Civil War: The largest in a series of Southern bread riots occurs in Richmond, Virginia.
Events.html: American Civil War: The largest in a series of Southern bread riots occurs in Richmond, Virginia.

Events.text: American Civil War: Defeat at the Third Battle of Petersburg forces the Army of Northern Virginia and the Confederate government to abandon Richmond, Virginia.
Events.html: American Civil War: Defeat at the Third Battle of Petersburg forces the Army of Northern Virginia and the Confederate government to abandon Richmond, Virginia.

Events.text: Canadian Cree warriors attack the village of Frog Lake, killing nine.
Events.html: Canadian Cree warriors attack the village of Frog Lake, killing nine.

Events.text: The United States Congress passes the Foraker Act, giving Puerto Rico limited self-rule.
Events.html: The United States Congress passes the Foraker Act, giving Puerto Rico limited self-rule.

Events.text: Dmitry Sipyagin, Minister of Interior of the Russian Empire, is assassinated in the Marie Palace, St Petersburg.
Events.html: Dmitry Sipyagin, Minister of Interior of the Russian Empire, is assassinated in the Marie Palace, St Petersburg.

Events.text: "Electric Theatre", the first full-time movie theater in the United States, opens in Los Angeles.
Events.html: 1902 – "Electric Theatre", the first full-time movie theater in the United States, opens in Los Angeles.

Events.text: The Australian Bureau of Statistics conducts the country's first national census.
Events.html: The Australian Bureau of Statistics conducts the country's first national census.

Events.text: The ill-fated RMS Titanic begins sea trials.
Events.html: The ill-fated RMS Titanic begins sea trials.

Events.text: World War I: United States President Woodrow Wilson asks the U.S. Congress for a declaration of war on Germany.
Events.html: World War I: United States President Woodrow Wilson asks the U.S. Congress for a declaration of war on Germany.

Events.text: The Autonomous Government of Khorasan, a military government encompassing the modern state of Iran, is established.
Events.html: The Autonomous Government of Khorasan, a military government encompassing the modern state of Iran, is established.

Events.text: After the mysterious death of Empress Zewditu, Haile Selassie is proclaimed emperor of Ethiopia.
Events.html: After the mysterious death of Empress Zewditu, Haile Selassie is proclaimed emperor of Ethiopia.

Events.text: As the World Turns and The Edge of Night premiere on CBS-TV. The two soaps become the first daytime dramas to debut in the 30-minute format.
Events.html: As the World Turns and The Edge of Night premiere on CBS-TV. The two soaps become the first daytime dramas to debut in the 30-minute format.

Events.text: Actor Charlie Chaplin returns to the United States for the first time since being labeled a communist during the Red Scare in the early 1950s.
Events.html: Actor Charlie Chaplin returns to the United States for the first time since being labeled a communist during the Red Scare in the early 1950s.

Events.text: Launch of the LexisNexis computerized legal research service.
Events.html: Launch of the LexisNexis computerized legal research service.

Events.text: Vietnam War: Thousands of civilian refugees flee from Quảng Ngãi Province in front of advancing North Vietnamese troops.
Events.html: Vietnam War: Thousands of civilian refugees flee from Quảng Ngãi Province in front of advancing North Vietnamese troops.

Events.text: A Soviet bio-warfare laboratory at Sverdlovsk accidentally releases airborne anthrax spores, killing 66 plus an unknown amount of livestock.
Events.html: A Soviet bio-warfare laboratory at Sverdlovsk accidentally releases airborne anthrax spores, killing 66 plus an unknown amount of livestock.

Events.text: United States President Jimmy Carter signs the Crude Oil Windfall Profits Tax Act.
Events.html: United States President Jimmy Carter signs the Crude Oil Windfall Profits Tax Act.

Events.text: Falklands War: Argentina invades the Falkland Islands.
Events.html: Falklands War: Argentina invades the Falkland Islands.

Events.text: Alabama governor George Wallace, a former segregationist, best known for the "Stand in the Schoolhouse Door", announces that he will not seek a fifth four-year term and will retire from public life upon the end of his term in January 1987.
Events.html: Alabama governor George Wallace, a former segregationist, best known for the "Stand in the Schoolhouse Door", announces that he will not seek a fifth four-year term and will retire from public life upon the end of his term in January 1987.

Events.text: Soviet leader Mikhail Gorbachev arrives in Havana, Cuba, to meet with Fidel Castro in an attempt to mend strained relations.
Events.html: Soviet leader Mikhail Gorbachev arrives in Havana, Cuba, to meet with Fidel Castro in an attempt to mend strained relations.

Events.text: Rita Johnston becomes the first female Premier of a Canadian province when she succeeds William Vander Zalm (who had resigned) as Premier of British Columbia.
Events.html: Rita Johnston becomes the first female Premier of a Canadian province when she succeeds William Vander Zalm (who had resigned) as Premier of British Columbia.

Events.text: In New York, Mafia boss John Gotti is convicted of murder and racketeering and is later sentenced to life in prison.
Events.html: In New York, Mafia boss John Gotti is convicted of murder and racketeering and is later sentenced to life in prison.

Events.text: Forty-two civilians were massacred in the town of Bijeljina.
Events.html: 1992 – Forty-two civilians were massacred in the town of Bijeljina.

Events.text: Israeli forces surround the Church of the Nativity in Bethlehem into which armed Palestinians had retreated.
Events.html: Israeli forces surround the Church of the Nativity in Bethlehem into which armed Palestinians had retreated.

links.title: Siege of the Church of the Nativity in Bethlehem

Events.text: Islamist terrorists involved in the 11 March 2004 Madrid attacks attempt to bomb the Spanish high-speed train AVE near Madrid; the attack is thwarted.
Events.html: Islamist terrorists involved in the 11 March 2004 Madrid attacks attempt to bomb the Spanish high-speed train AVE near Madrid; the attack is thwarted.

Events.text: Over 60 tornadoes break out in the United States; Tennessee is hardest hit with 29 people killed.
Events.html: Over 60 tornadoes break out in the United States; Tennessee is hardest hit with 29 people killed.

Events.text: A mass shooting at Oikos University in California leaves seven people dead and three injured.
Events.html: A mass shooting at Oikos University in California leaves seven people dead and three injured.

Events.text: A spree shooting occurs at the Fort Hood army base in Texas, with four dead, including the gunman, and 16 others injured.
Events.html: A spree shooting occurs at the Fort Hood army base in Texas, with four dead, including the gunman, and 16 others injured.

Events.text: Gunmen attack Garissa University College in Kenya, killing at least 148 people and wounding 79 others.
Events.html: Gunmen attack Garissa University College in Kenya, killing at least 148 people and wounding 79 others.
